page.title: 10Local administration I.
page.content:
Administration of the area takes place at a number of levels. The lowest level of administration is the parish council - Ingatestone and Fryerning parish council has limited powers over some purely local matters. The council consists of thirteen members who are democratically elected, there is no sub-division of the parish into wards for electoral purposes. There is a small parish council office in the same building as Ingatestone community club at the northern end of the High Street.
Only the area roughly to the east of the River Wid lies within Ingatestone parish, the area to the west is not administered at parish council level as only certain areas retained parish councils after local government re-organisation in the 1970's.
